properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 1:17PM MST until January 6 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW POSSIBLE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY
EVENING...

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10
inches with isolated amounts of 12 to 15 inches at ridge top
level. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Serra Madre Mountains and southwestern carbon County.

* WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 6 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. Trails and paths could be
covered by heavy snow. Avoid outdoor recreation in the back
country without the proper gear. Gusty winds could bring down
tree branches.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM MST MONDAY
